lead_paragraph: WOLFSON--Cyril Z.,age 90, died peacefully, December 14, 2015, at his home in NYC. Cyril was born April 2, 1925. Cyril served his country in the army during WWII, and was discharged with full honors. He was also involved in the mining of Uranium in Moab, Utah. He became a real estate executive with Herbert Charles & Co. He then partnered with Sheldon Evans. He was a member of the real estate board of New York. His proudest achievement was to develop and construct the Sheraton Old Town Inn in Albuquerque, NM. Cyril was an inspiration and mentor to many of those who were fortunate to know him. He married his first wife Edith Varsa who predeceased him in 1999. He is survived by his beloved wife, Soledad Wolfson. He will be dearly missed by his step-children, family, and friends. He was cremated with his ashes being interred on January 2, 2016 at the Long Island National Cemetery following a military burial funeral. A memorial service will follow. 1/3
